item.title: Anette add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Anette add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I wanted to touch him, to tell him that even if everyone left everyone, I would never leave him, he talked and talked, his words fell through him, trying to find the floor to his sadness." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Anette add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Being with him made my brain quiet. I didn't have to invent a thing." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Anette add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It has shown me that everything is illuminated in the light of the past. It is always along the side of us...on the inside, looking out." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Anette add a quote by Michel Houellebecq
item.description: "As a teenager, Michel believed that suffering conferred dignity on a person. Now he had to admit that he had been wrong. What conferred dignity on people was television. " -- Michel Houellebecq
